title: Settings the parameters for 4,4 bonds on Vikings Finance
body:
We are excited to be on the verge of launching 4,4 bonds on Viking Finance and are seeking community feedback as to some specific parameters around the implementation of this.

BACKGROUND

4,4 bonds are seen by some as the next generation of bonding for reserve backed currencies. With traditional bonds, users purchase VAL in exchange for assets such as MIM or MIM/VAL LP tokens, and receive VAL in return. In order to maximise returns these vested rewards would need to be deposited/staked prior to each rebase over the duration of the vesting period.

Vikings Finance has a dynamic rebasing model, currently rebasing around once every 5 minutes. To mathematically optimise yield, manual compounding of vested rewards would need to be completed regularly.

4,4 solves this. Users purchasing 4,4 bonds receive rewards in the form of sVAL, meaning their rewards are always staked and earning from them. Even if they haven’t redeemed their rewards. This means that once a user bonds, they only need to redeem once (of course they can still do this more, at any time they want), at the end of the vesting period and will get even more benefits than someone redeeming prior to every rebase!

PROPOSAL

We have decided to implement 4,4 bonds on the AVAX/MIM Vikings AMM LP pair to start. The high volume nature of this pair, we feel, will be beneficial in the early stage rollout of our Vikings AMM.

We are seeking feedback today as to the duration of the vesting period for 4,4 bonds. Shorter vesting periods mean more VAL tokens in circulation over a shorter period of time and could dilute the token more. We believe that due to reward being extremely good (buying staked val instead of regular val) period should be longer.

Most of the time, discounts on VAL are offered compared with market prices, with the tradeoff being this vesting period.
